Description: Two or more reactants combine to form a single product

Reactions occurring between solid reactants
Reactions that produce gaseous products
A more reactive metal displaces a less reactive metal from solution
Reactions involving electron transfer at electrode-electrolyte interfaces
General Formula: Oxidation at anode, Reduction at cathode

Description: Chemical decomposition using electric current
Spontaneous redox reactions producing electrical energy
Deposition of metals using electric current
Reactions catalyzed by biological enzymes
Transfer of functional groups between molecules
Breaking of bonds using water
Biosynthetic reactions that build complex molecules
Breakdown reactions that release energy
Catalysis where catalyst and reactants are in the same phase

Reaction where one of the products acts as a catalyst
General Formula: A → B (where B catalyzes A → B)

Light-induced structural rearrangements
Addition reactions initiated by light

Polymerization using ionic initiators
